SEARCH
Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.LevelCommonElements.visuals

Class HeartDisplay

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.LevelCommonElements.visuals.HeartDisplay
public class HeartDisplay extends Object
Represents a visual display of hearts in the game.

This class is responsible for creating and displaying a set of heart images on the screen to represent the player's health. The hearts are displayed in a horizontal box (HBox) at a specified position and can be updated or removed.

  • Constructor Details

    • HeartDisplay

      public HeartDisplay(double xPosition, double yPosition, int heartsToDisplay)
      Constructs a HeartDisplay and initializes the heart container and the hearts to be displayed.
      Parameters:
      xPosition - The X position of the heart display on the screen.
      yPosition - The Y position of the heart display on the screen.
      heartsToDisplay - The number of hearts to display initially.

  • Method Details

    • initializeContainer

      private void initializeContainer()
      Initializes the container that holds the heart images. The container is an HBox positioned at the specified coordinates.

    • initializeHearts

      private void initializeHearts()
      Initializes and adds the specified number of heart images to the container. The hearts are positioned in a horizontal layout within the container.

    • removeHeart

      public void removeHeart()
      Removes one heart from the container. This simulates the player losing health by removing a heart from the display.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the heart display by clearing all hearts and reinitializing the original number of hearts.

    • getContainer

      public javafx.scene.layout.HBox getContainer()
      Returns the container that holds the heart images.
      Returns:
      The HBox container with the heart images.
